subject: Perl Webinar
header: I am rather speechless today, so let's just get on with the content. ~ Gabor

entries.title: A Long-Time Perl Hacker's View of the Perl World: Past, Present and Future
entries.text: While many claim that Perl is a dying language, ActiveState's Perl business is vibrant and growing. Join our webinar on June 15th as ActiveState's Tom Radcliffe and guest speaker Jason McIntosh (co-author of "Perl & XML") discuss all things Perl: its past, present and what the future holds.

entries.title: POD speculation
entries.author: flavio_poletti
entries.text: Do you document your functions as =headN or in a list as =item ?  (Editor: I think POD should have semantic tags such as =function and =method)

entries.title: Writing a simple splunk API client.
entries.author: kieren_diment
entries.text: Splunk is a log and monitoring analytics toolkit. This article is about a client written in Perl but not on CPAN yet.

entries.title: Testing timeout with cmp_ok
entries.author: gabor_szabo
entries.text: It is easy to check equality using the 'is' function of Test::More, but how can you check if a number falls between two values? (screencast+article)

entries.title: sparrowhub.org updated
entries.author: alexey_melezhik
entries.text: You might recall Sparrow provides automation and SparrowhHub is a list of plugins for it. In other words it is a repository of reusable automation scripts.

entries.title: Perl v5.24 adds a line break word boundary
entries.author: brian_d_foy
entries.text: Perl v5.22 added a few new word boundary anchors such as \b{sb},  \b{wb}, and \b{gcb}. Perl v5.24 trumped that with \b{lb}.

entries.title: Set minimum version number in every Perl file
entries.author: gabor_szabo
entries.text: Use the Compatibility::PerlMinimumVersionAndWhy policy of Perl::Critic
